topic.title: GPU improvements

topic.domains: (topic task) (topic concept) (topic concept glossentry) (topic concept glossgroup) (topic reference) (topic troubleshooting++task) (topic task) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
topic.title: Full GPU support for Killough hysteresis models

body.p: The Killough hysteresis model for both relative permeability and capillary pressure is now fully supported for GPU-accelerated simulations. It is expected that the performance of models containing this feature should be greatly enhanced in full GPU simulations compared to previous releases. This includes the functionality activated through the advanced fields ScaledImbibitionLookUp and ImmobileWaterImbibition for the KilloughCapPressureHysteresis node, alongside the ApplyCorrection field for the KilloughRelPermHysteresis node. This feature is activated automatically when the simulation is run on full GPU mode, and no modifications to the input data are required.

topic.title: GPU linear solver performance improvements

body.p: The GPU linear solver performance can be greatly improved by applying a good choice of coloring scheme. The different options can now be controlled by setting the LinearSolverColoring field under the GPUMgr node.

To simplify the selection of a good scheme, an AUTOMATIC coloring control has been introduced and chosen as the new default setting. By tailoring the coloring algorithm to each model, this new control can often deliver greatly improved simulation performance without any modifications to the simulation results. In most cases, the AUTOMATIC setting should provide the best performance, and it should not normally be necessary to use any other settings.

The following figure shows the normalized linear solver time, compared to the pre-2022.1 default, for a range of realistic models. Depending on the characteristics of each model, in some cases the new AUTOMATIC setting might not affect performance, while in other cases it provides a very significant improvement.

fig.title: Linear solver speed-up over previous behavior for a set of realistic models
